changeHistory.comment:
Raghu, this looks to me like a test issue downstream of the eval work we did. The inner eval will encounter the retry and send it back up to the parent exception which will retry and do another xdmp:forest-restart().

So basically, you'll keep restarting the forest over and over again until you hit the query timeout, which I suspect may be set very large?

If you don't have a really large timeout set, then there may be a real bug where the outer transaction is retrying forever.

Wayne, Query time out is set to 5 mins.

 <h:test h:username="admin" h:password="admin">
    <h:name>bug11668</h:name>
    <h:comment-expected-result>should not time out</h:comment-expected-result>
    <h:time-out>300000</h:time-out>
    <h:query>
      <![CDATA[
        xquery version "1.0-ml";
        try{
        (: Testing for a bug that allowed an infinite number of
           retries in xdmp:eval. If it finishes, no bug.
           It will return a "forest not available" error. :)
           let $code := 'xdmp:forest-restart(xdmp:forest("bug11668F")),
              xdmp:sleep(1)'

           return
          xdmp:eval($code, (),
             <options xmlns="xdmp:eval">
                <database>{xdmp:database("bug11668DB")}</database>
             </options>)
        }
        catch($e){
                if($e//*:message = ("Forest not mounted", "Forest not available")) then fn:true() else $e
        }
      ]]>
    </h:query>
  </h:test>

This sigarbt also seen on Linux Cluster environment on 5.0 on 20130224 nightly regression.

https://regression-status.marklogic.com/space2/diff-archive/b5_0/2013-02-24/linux-64-rh54-cluster-RH5.4/qa-criticalErrors.Split1.html
